Guide to the Helen Martha Wright Papers
1774-1969
MS 3111
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks, revised by Marybeth Kavanagh 2022

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-02-28 14:20:21 -0500.

physdesc.extent: in 10 cartons, one flat box, and one oversize folder

did.abstract: This collection consists mainly of Wright's genealogical research notes organized by subject, as well as some of her personal papers including photographs and correspondence. Of special interest are Civil War era diaries and correspondence in the Connett Family files.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers. Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Helen Martha Wright papers, MS 3111, New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Helen Martha Wright (1884-1969) was an historian, genealogist, and teacher from New Jersey.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: No information is available at this time.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by subject.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The New-York Historical's Patricia D. Klingenstein Library holds a number of volumes written by Helen Martha Wright.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains books from Wright's personal library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Connett family photos, diaries, correspondence. Includes material from Cornelia Connett, Clara Connett Wright, Belinda Connett, Will Thompson. The correspondence is mostly to and from Will Thompson, a Union soldier in a New Jersey brigade. The diaries were kept by Cornelia Connett and her daughter, Clara Connett Wright.
